pros:
Always hiring 
Lots of overtime (due to turnover)
Don’t really need to know anything as you will be micromanaged by clueless management that will blame you for everything and change policy as they go. 
Relatively decent benefits package 
Only speaking for the unit I worked
cons:
You will accrue PTO but not be allowed to use it, so you will need to cash it out. 
Management will not help you, and complaints are not confidential. Your supervisor will be informed if you try to make any complaints. 
Bidding out will not happen and if it does be prepared to be held the maximum before you are allowed to go. 
No attempts are made at retention, basically you can be replaced and are made very much aware of this. 
They own or are buying everything around. 
They will fabricate reasons to get rid of you, I’ve seen it done to some of the best workers.

pros: The reason I wanted to work at DRMC is because its close to my home. I am glad I made the decision to apply for a job at DRMC, the other employees are extremely friendly and made me feel very welcome at my neew job. The houssekeeping manager is a wonderful woman who cares about her employees and makes it a point to talk to everyone every morning. She always has a smile for everyone!
cons: The only downside to working at DRMC is the pay that housekeeping gets. We work very hard and don't get paid what we are worth.

pros: The people who work there, below administration, do not gossip. Because the area is so isolated and so many have deep roots in the community, employees tend not to gossip for fear of causing unnecessary drama which could lead to dismissal.
cons: Senior management has no vision for the future. The mantra is go as cheap as possible on goods and equipment, and if something is not working out then terminate employees for no cause. I learned this the hard way and later met several other docs who experienced the same history. It's an economically depressed and isolated area which is best avoided.

review_title: Dirty in more ways then one
pros: Benefits include insurance, PTO, and sick time
cons: Majority of staff are unhappy, discriminate by department, and lazy.  Patient care comes second to money.  More focus is placed on the numbers then the treatment of patients and staff.  This extends to more then just the housekeeping department.  Housekeeping is  currently managed by an outside company by the name of Crothall, not the hospital itself.
